_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



1. The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the facility:  

The Linde Gas North America, LLC facility located in Blythewood, SC, complies with NFPA requirements for LP-Gas storage, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws. If an emergency accidental release was to occur involving our propane or acetylene storage/handling systems, it is our policy to immediately notify the Blythewood Fire Department, who would respond to the emergency. In addition, each employee is trained monthly on safety policies and procedures. Employees also participate in Quarterly Safety Committee meetings for the facility. Hazards identified during the meetings are corrected accordingly.



2. A description of the facility and the regulated substances handled:

The Linde Gas facility manufactures and stores acetylene. Acetylene is put into storage cylinders of various sizes  

before they are sold and shipped from the facility. The acetylene manufacturing/handling/storage process

consists of chemical acetylene trailers, a medium pressure acetylene generator, and a high pressure cylinder

filling area.

Acetylene is compressed using chemical acetylene stored on trailers that have acetylene cylinders manifolded

together. The piping from the manifold runs underground to the northwest corner of the plant, and then

runs above ground to the generator and compressor room. The supply lines are equipped with pull away

protection, flow reducing pressure regulators, 1.2" orifice plates, large flash arrestor, and check valves to

protect against reverse flow.

The generator is piped to the compressors which are housed in the same room as the generator.



3. The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:

The Linde Gas facility complies with USEPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable federal, state and

local codes and regulations. The propane and acetylene syst

ems are designed, installed, and maintained in

accordance with NFPA and state law at the Linde Gas facility in Blythewood, SC. All leaks are immediately

reported to supervision. Prompt clean-up of accidental releases and investigation into root causes are

conducted to make corrections and to prevent future occurrences.



4. Five-year accident history:

The Linde facility in Blythewood, SC, has not had any reportable accidents in the last five years.



5. The emergency response program:

In the event of an emergency accidental release involving our propane or acetylene storage system, it is Linde

Gas' policy to immediately notify the Blythewood Fire Department, who would respond to the emergency. We

have communicated this policy with the Blythewood Fire Department. All employees have access to Linde Gas emergency action plan and emergency action training is conducted annually. An ADT alarm system is

installed in critical areas and a fire drill is performed each year with all employees.



6. Planned changes to improve safety:

Periodic tours and training are available for firefighting staff which serve to better our relationship and

involvement with Blythewood Fire Department.
